instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3435 , PP18V5_DCIN_ISOL_R is low
threads.message:
hi , 
    board no 820-3435
     R7005  pin 1  : 16.5v
                  pin 2  : 3.0v
changed U7090 : still same 
L7095 diode value is 0.335 both side
if make jumper r7005 pin 1 to D7005 pin 3 board turn on ,,,
 help me pls

threads.title: 820-3435 , PP18V5_DCIN_ISOL_R is low
threads.message: yes but not sure . i will chk tomorrow

threads.title: 820-3435 , PP18V5_DCIN_ISOL_R is low
threads.message:
Is not normal to have such voltage over 10 ohm resistor.
It should get really hot.
Because you've said board works when bypass R/D7005.
Change C7090-92 and D7005 too.

threads.title: 820-3435 , PP18V5_DCIN_ISOL_R is low
threads.message:
Its done after change R7005 , ( allready changed  before but that R7005 also damaged )
 it was 280 ohms ..
tnx .

threads.title: 820-3435 , PP18V5_DCIN_ISOL_R is low
threads.message:
So you didn't even measure the resistor when I asked you :mad:.
You should have the machine repaired yesterday...
